subject: p15792940
Findings: Multifocal parenchymal opacities, predominating on the right at the level of the hilus as well as in the retrocardiac and left lateral basal lung areas. The concern for multifocal pneumonia must be raised. In addition, a small left pleural effusion could be present. Moderate cardiomegaly, no pulmonary edema. Right internal jugular vein catheter in situ. No pneumothorax.
